positive.review: Challenging and Unique. I've played a couple rougue likes before but this one in particular has interesting mechanics and doesn't hold back punishing players and promotes them to actually study the move sets for each enemies and bosses. Definitely recommended.

Very good and unique Roguelike, the skull mechanic is refreshing and offers a lot of replayability. There's no doubt this game has a lot of charm, the story is actually pretty good and the combat is simple yet statisfying, the theorycrafting and building is very good with all of the unlockable items and Quintessences, I'm enjoying my time with it.
It's fun. I spent a long time playing it. The hardest content is REEEALLY hard, though. I don't know how anyone could play that without cheating.
Fun game. has everything you would want from it and more. Also has DLC that isn't required but makes the game more fun and gives the story a nice closer.

This game was so good I even got it on Steam. It comepetes with Isaac on build variety and depth, the art's great plus it's all just so so fun! The only downside I can even think of is the beginning grind. It takesa a bit to unlock all stat upgrades and unlock items, skulls. But that doesn't even take that long, so even that isn't that much of an issue.
It has great replayability, for reference across all platforms i have over 300 hours. 5/5 would reccomend
The graphics are amazing, and the gameplay is outstanding.
Game is super, great plot and game mechanics. Also huge variety of characters

Not very far in, and this is already fantastic. Abilities and items for just about any play-style; anything and more from button-mashers, to heavy-hitters, even to summoners and turrets.
The NPCs are campy and fun, and the story has just the right amount of endearing without taking itself too seriously. 
Easy recommend if you like similar things in the genres it dabbles in.
I'm really enjoying myself so far.  I don't typically enjoy Roguelites.  I'm having a blast with this one, though.
There is exactly one word needed to describe the joy I get from this game. Predator.

[h1]The Ultimate Knight[/h1]

So I have to say the story is well put although be it short. The fact that you can switch out between different forms or power ups (However you see them as)  Which each one is unique and interesting to use. Yes that Includes the DLC ones. The Devs Really put some thought and even gave some forms a unique nod to famous characters from many different genres which Hey I have to give credit where it is due! It's not difficult but it is important to pay attention to patterns otherwise you will find yourself getting upset easily. That said I recommend this if for nothing else but a little fun and it's replay value which there will be a lot of that if your going for the achievements!
fun game, worth the money.
fun but challenging,
funny skeleton guy so this game is great
its peak trust me also dlc is 100% worth just get it

very hard, very fun 
give the game a try
best rogue like ever
This game=Free dopamine.
it gud.
A great game
good game
it gud
it gud
cool game i love it
very good
good game
Nice
i caught him dancing with toriel
nice
buy the dlc
peak
works great on steam deck it says its unsupported but it works great

I love nearly everything this game has to offer, except one thing: it's difficulty.
Some people just want its variety of stuff, not the high difficulty.
If I'm bot mistaken, there's no Easy mode in this game. I love this game...but I can't have fun with it without cheating (which I have been always trying to avoid). I just want to chill while playing it, for all the huge variety of contents this game has to offer, without losing my time using cheats.
It's still DEFINITELY a Recommend. Many players of this genre seems to like the high difficulty commonly seem in the genre itself.

I love it, one of the best metroidvania hack and slashes of all time. There is a lot of replay ability and to me it is very comparable to dead cells in terms of gameplay and story, its not a copy by any means it is unique but similar.
It's fun for a pass time. I don't really play on the hard mode since I just like to explore games, but I highly recommend it.

Challenging and Unique. I've played a couple rougue likes before but this one in particular has interesting mechanics and doesn't hold back punishing players and promotes them to actually study the move sets for each enemies and bosses. Definitely recommended.

Very good and unique Roguelike, the skull mechanic is refreshing and offers a lot of replayability. There's no doubt this game has a lot of charm, the story is actually pretty good and the combat is simple yet statisfying, the theorycrafting and building is very good with all of the unlockable items and Quintessences, I'm enjoying my time with it.
It's fun. I spent a long time playing it. The hardest content is REEEALLY hard, though. I don't know how anyone could play that without cheating.

It's really good and very easily replayable with its roguelike structure and varied Skulls. 

Just don't be surprised if you lose interest in the game while attempting the dark mirror. By that point it becomes more of a chore than an actual engaging experience.
Didn’t expect much, ended up vibing with a bunch of skeletons on a murder mission. Solid roguelite comfort food.

The game has a good challenge factor to it with RNG being a huge factor in what "Skuls" you get and what items you get as well. It definitely has a difficulty spike but the story is interesting to say the least.
Fun game. has everything you would want from it and more. Also has DLC that isn't required but makes the game more fun and gives the story a nice closer.

This game was so good I even got it on Steam. It comepetes with Isaac on build variety and depth, the art's great plus it's all just so so fun! The only downside I can even think of is the beginning grind. It takesa a bit to unlock all stat upgrades and unlock items, skulls. But that doesn't even take that long, so even that isn't that much of an issue.
It has great replayability, for reference across all platforms i have over 300 hours. 5/5 would reccomend
The graphics are amazing, and the gameplay is outstanding.
Game is super, great plot and game mechanics. Also huge variety of characters

Not very far in, and this is already fantastic. Abilities and items for just about any play-style; anything and more from button-mashers, to heavy-hitters, even to summoners and turrets.
The NPCs are campy and fun, and the story has just the right amount of endearing without taking itself too seriously. 
Easy recommend if you like similar things in the genres it dabbles in.

I struggled with this game for a while but after taking a break and coming back I found I was treating it more like a hack and slash, it is not. Hang back, take your time and dodge! 

Story was okay but I wasn't super invested, also learning which doors lead where helped decide how I want to build Skul as the green doors are for more skulls and the gold doors are for coin and items. Overall a solid game

An extremely underrated roguelite with incredibly satisfying progression and an incredible amount of end-game/post-game content. The game can be frustrating if you don't take your time, but certain builds can be forced (to an extent) to fit your playstyle. Please give this game a chance
Very nice game, Many ways to play and very divers play styles, with hundreds of skuls, charms, and more its one of my favorite games. would 1000% recommend.
amazing game lots of ways to play and its flat out amazing

Good to try this game, easy to learns the mechanic but hard to play well. 
Good game
Awesome game. Its so addicting to try to get different builds!

I love this game. So many ways to play. Personally I love spirits and thing that gives you magic damage per each spirit. Also love samurai and alchemist. I want second part but we will see if we will have it

i dont know how to explain this but this is both the best and worst game i have ever played. it is both exactly like dead cells and nothing like it. it is very difficult but all the enemies and bosses are easy. I genuinely dont understand what this game has done to me but i keep coming back.

This was super fun to play and so many different build potentials. I only got through the base story as of writing this review but the amount of content that is in the game is really awesome. Even casual people can enjoy it with just the base story and anyone who loves a challenge the games difficulty can keep climbing and climbing to crazy heights
Has some issues with enemy spam, but a lot of really unique powers and playstyles, dlc is a bit unbalanced though, since you can get one of the best skulls in the game every time at the very start.

Years ago, this game brought my attention by a youtuber known as Wambu. Since then, I've enjoyed countless hours of this game! If you are a fan of "one & done" runs with beautiful pixel art & amazing music to set the atmosphere then you are sure to love Skul The Hero Slayer! Plenty of skulls to pick from with the option of having just two skulls only! Most deal physical damage while most deal magic damage, the choice is yours at this rattling adventure full of tough opponents & bosses! The story is also really good, & the after game stuff is the icing on the cake. I 100% recommend this game & it is my all time favorite!
It's adorably cute and quite fun. It's definitely roguelite and I quite enjoy the concept of the monsters fighting back against the bad humans that did not honor their word

TL;DR : great game, give more bones pl0x

Gameplay 8/10 My only gripes are 1: the amount of bones you need for upgrading vs the amount of bones you get is really whack. 2: the amount of gems you get skyrockets after the second boss(who is usually the run ender if you don't already have a near perfect build going) which is a problem when gems are what you need EARLY in the game.
Balancing 7/10 Some items/skills/skuls are FAR better then others. (not even based on rarity btw)
Visuals 10/10 Love the style of the game!
Audio 10/10 The sounds are just right, and the music is great!
Level Design 6/10 Some areas are poorly designed. from ledges that you barely can't reach to sadisticly places traps on area with little room.
All in all the game is great, and I recommend it to anyone who wants a challange.
Thick women,Peak gameplay,awesome sprite designs.what more could you want?

고맙다 스컬 고생했어
스컬 당신은 우리들의 영웅입니다

아니ㅠㅠ 스토리 기대 하나도 안 했는데 감동적이야...
스컬 ㅠㅠ 마음이 아프군
게임도 재밌음... 성장 스텟을 찍을 수 있는 시스템이 있어서 맘에 듦 하루에 한두판 정도 가볍게 하기 딱 좋음 재미따!!!!
나같은 컨트롤고자는 루키모드 키고 하면 재밌게 하실 수 있으심ㅎㅎㅎ
I'm really enjoying myself so far.  I don't typically enjoy Roguelites.  I'm having a blast with this one, though.
Great combat, good variety in runs
it an amazing game that every person who love rougelite should play

negative.review:
Way too high variance for me. 
You're either a god that has unlimited sustain and spits on the enemies, or you get 1 tapped by a random boss because you got unlucky with resources, skulls, items, or all 3.

Totally ruins any feel of progression with a power-level so incredibly inconsistent.

Extremely random, repetitive, the action is a chaotic mess, barely legible yet the game is too demanding and you need to read attacks that are poorly telegraphed.
The momentum never feels right either, and nothing is explained. The meaning of the doors, of the symbols on items, skull rarity, you have to figure all this cryptic stuff by yourself.

Game has charm and potential but is ultimately a total failure.
Not good
too good

Skul: The Hero Slayer has a lot going for it. I really like the concept of each skull offering a completely different playstyle, and the upgrade system is both varied and interesting. The way upgrades interact can be genuinely fun and clever.

That said, I don’t find the combat particularly rewarding. Runs often feel dull in the first half, with uninspiring powers that only become engaging much later on. The game also seems designed with the expectation that you’ll take a lot of hits. Too often when I die, it doesn’t feel like I was outplayed—it feels like I never really had a chance with the character and upgrades I ended up with.

Winning runs tend to come from getting a strong skull early rather than from playing especially well, which makes success feel more about luck than skill.

For all it's diversity and creativity it's not a very enjoyable experience nor is it well-balanced. Success massively depends on getting lucky with a good early upgrade. I stumbled into a broken build where all I had to do was keep dashing around the map endlessly and everything died. A whole bunch of upgrades are just clearly bad and non-viable.

Numbers are obscured from the player leaving you guessing over the value of things. Loot eventually becomes frustrating because you have limited slots and have to compare each new option to the nine you already have and try to work out which is superior. It just becomes a chore. They also added some resource sinks at home base so you have somewhere to dump currency. One guy says he'll do repairs for 1500, then nothing happens and he asks for 5000 more. Starts to feel like a mobile game with the moving goalposts.

typical rogulike issue where the game is actually impossible unless you get the ultimate highroll or  spend 30 hours a day playing, not to mention half of the story is locked behind the even harder mode.

Be aware the controller support for this game is absolutely random. Some people have no problem, others' controller stop working randomly, and others like me can't make it work whatsoever. Despite the various fixes that are posted online, nothing worked for me. I cannot therefor recommend a game I cannot play.

I really want to like this game, I have given myself a few tries but I just can't seem to enjoy it. Combat isn't very fun. It's way too fast and chaotic, all the debris flying around when you fight obscures your vision so you can't really see and avoid all attacks, too many enemies spawn on top of each other and often you just spam around the attack button, it's not very satisfying. I think it would have been better if it was at least 30-40% slower. Boss fights are alright tho.

I gave it a chance... i really did, so much wasted potential too, upgrades are poorly placed between bosses, no sense of achievement tracking, no sense of item tracking, no sense of skull tracking the game is just a giant question mark unless you use sources outside the game to figure out what there is to accomplish other than that the game is just a giant lead on keeping you bewildered on what to do next not to mention it being extremely hard to fight right out of the gate, once you take the first boss down It's the only way to start gaining quartz to even start progressing, once you finally make it to chapter 2 again, horrible and poorly placed skull upgrade NPC that's always placed in the zone but wait a sec... you gotta take down that difficult boss first and then you can fill your skull with bone fragments. the game is also punishing on anything spent so if you spend wrong you also get punished for that too.

Way too high variance for me. 
You're either a god that has unlimited sustain and spits on the enemies, or you get 1 tapped by a random boss because you got unlucky with resources, skulls, items, or all 3.

Totally ruins any feel of progression with a power-level so incredibly inconsistent.

My 3rd boss was a lady that just healed permanently, so I couldn't actually deal enough damage to progress as she outhealed it and I had to just quit the run

The game itself seems fun and the screenshots and videos made me want to keep playing because it seems like it gets fun eventually but the first 3 or 4 runs I did were just so boring I can't continue with it

Extremely random, repetitive, the action is a chaotic mess, barely legible yet the game is too demanding and you need to read attacks that are poorly telegraphed.
The momentum never feels right either, and nothing is explained. The meaning of the doors, of the symbols on items, skull rarity, you have to figure all this cryptic stuff by yourself.

Game has charm and potential but is ultimately a total failure.

I really want to like this game, I have given myself a few tries but I just can't seem to enjoy it. Combat isn't very fun. It's way too fast and chaotic, all the debris flying around when you fight obscures your vision so you can't really see and avoid all attacks, too many enemies spawn on top of each other and often you just spam around the attack button, it's not very satisfying. I think it would have been better if it was at least 30-40% slower. Boss fights are alright tho.

Way too high variance for me. 
You're either a god that has unlimited sustain and spits on the enemies, or you get 1 tapped by a random boss because you got unlucky with resources, skulls, items, or all 3.

Totally ruins any feel of progression with a power-level so incredibly inconsistent.

My 3rd boss was a lady that just healed permanently, so I couldn't actually deal enough damage to progress as she outhealed it and I had to just quit the run

The game itself seems fun and the screenshots and videos made me want to keep playing because it seems like it gets fun eventually but the first 3 or 4 runs I did were just so boring I can't continue with it

Extremely random, repetitive, the action is a chaotic mess, barely legible yet the game is too demanding and you need to read attacks that are poorly telegraphed.
The momentum never feels right either, and nothing is explained. The meaning of the doors, of the symbols on items, skull rarity, you have to figure all this cryptic stuff by yourself.

Game has charm and potential but is ultimately a total failure.

i asked for a refund becuase hte games bad and didnt get it 

Sad
it is garbe
Not good
too good

Skul: The Hero Slayer has a lot going for it. I really like the concept of each skull offering a completely different playstyle, and the upgrade system is both varied and interesting. The way upgrades interact can be genuinely fun and clever.

That said, I don’t find the combat particularly rewarding. Runs often feel dull in the first half, with uninspiring powers that only become engaging much later on. The game also seems designed with the expectation that you’ll take a lot of hits. Too often when I die, it doesn’t feel like I was outplayed—it feels like I never really had a chance with the character and upgrades I ended up with.

Winning runs tend to come from getting a strong skull early rather than from playing especially well, which makes success feel more about luck than skill.

typical rogulike issue where the game is actually impossible unless you get the ultimate highroll or  spend 30 hours a day playing, not to mention half of the story is locked behind the even harder mode.
